summary: An email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York forwarding a judicial opinion by Judge Maxwell that resolved the majority of the defense's pretrial motions in the Maxwell case, with thanks for guidance on briefing, particularly on the statute of limitations issue.

persons.name: Judge Maxwell
persons.context: Issued the attached opinion resolving the majority of the defense's pretrial motions in the case.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Author of the email, part of the prosecution team in the Southern District of New York, expressing thanks for guidance on briefing the pretrial motions.

connections.description: The prosecutor is referencing and forwarding a judicial opinion issued by Judge Maxwell on the case.

events.title: Issuance of Maxwell Opinion
events.description: Judge Maxwell issued an opinion resolving the majority of the defense's pretrial motions in the Maxwell case.

locations.name: Southern District of New York
locations.context: Jurisdiction where the Assistant United States Attorney works and the case is being prosecuted.

locations.name: One Saint Andrew's Plaza
locations.context: Address associated with the Assistant United States Attorney's office.

keyFacts: Judge Maxwell issued an opinion resolving most of the defense's pretrial motions in the Maxwell case.
The statute of limitations issue was highlighted as particularly thorny and a focus of the prosecution's briefing.
The email is from a federal prosecutor expressing gratitude for external guidance on the legal issues in the case.
